title: New Batch of Texture Rebalances!
body:
Hey folks! Ququroon here!

[I know I have a thread over on the PBE that's been sitting up there in the announcements for a while](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-pbe-feedback/jEQYuEHl-ongoing-mass-texture-rebalancing) (that totally has a ton of context if you're not familiar with this!), but I wanted to cross the streams and open up the feedback channel a little bit. At least for now, because my sleep schedule is OP and because I like you guys. Except for that guy. That guy *sucks*. 

So here's the link: 
http://imgur.com/a/x4BpK

I'll be hanging out for a bit, so lemme know whatcha think! I'd also appreciate to know who you'd prefer to see, if anyone. I'm curious. Totally. That's the ticket.  

REMEMBER BECAUSE I GET THIS A LOT. THIS HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH A CHAMPION'S UPDATE SCHEDULE. THIS IS A BANDAID TO A LARGER PROBLEM, BUT HOPEFULLY A BANDAID THAT YOU FOLKS LIKE.

replies.body:
Can you please move Groovy {{champion:26}}'s clock to 4:20 ?

Please.
New Teemo Skin Confirmed!

Lol. . .

Weeding out.
This is the first time I've seen these before, and I hate them. They look childish. Sorry.

Hey dude, sorry you don't like them. 

I'd like to understand what exactly you don't like, if you'd care to indulge me. Maybe I can explain some of the rational behind the changes?

> Hey dude, sorry you don't like them. 
> 
> I'd like to understand what exactly you don't like, if you'd care to indulge me. Maybe I can explain some of the rational behind the changes?

Its hard to describe.. but they just feel really "dull" in a sense. I can't quite put my finger on it, but some of the textures just really seem washed out and as if they don't fit at all. Like compare the last caitlyn skin (is that officer caitlyn? ) with the frosted ezreal skin. Caitlyn is incredibly defined where as ezreal looks like he lost a ton of detail with the color choices. Or even the two Morderkaiser skins look washed out.

The "dullness" you guys are seeing is them desaturating all of the textures. They're doing it with pretty much every single re-texture so that they better fit the palette of the new SR.

You may not have noticed it because the new map is beautiful in a lot of ways (being more lifelike and realistic), but it's a LOT less colorful than the current SR. The reason for this is all centered around one of their core design principles - 'clarity'. They want everything (or at least when able) to be easily understandable/readable at first sight and intuitive to anyone watching or playing. This especially applies to those doing so for the first time. 

Different elements in the game (champions, buildings, terrain, creeps, champs, particles, buffs, objectives, etc..) have varying degrees of visual importance. I think a RIoter has listed it somewhere in full before, but the most important ones to know are that they prioritize particles/abilities over champions and champions take priority over the terrain/map (In terms of saturation). They want abilities to 'pop' in comparison to the map, so that it's very clear what's a skillshot, or aura, or field, etc. so that it's very clear what is affecting what. The idea is that this will make things much easier to understand for LCS viewers and new players, but obviously current players as well. A good comparison would be the reason why we like to shoot fireworks in the night sky, rather than a... sunset over a vibrant mountain range, for example... I don't know. But you get the idea. 

As well as desaturating the new textures, they're also removing lots of the clutter (shadowing, detailing, etc..). Again, this is just for readability. Having really cool detailed textures is cool and all; they're really pretty. But it's kind of just unnecessary 'visual noise' for the average player/viewer. You really only appreciate that stuff when you are zoomed in and/or out of combat. 

Here are some quick examples I went and found so you can see what I'm talking about (old ones on the left):
http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-SXpCP0_e3X8/VCYV6YG58sI/AAAAAAAAZ3E/miKftbHHhHA/s1600/blitz.jpg

http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-pg_9gTr_cR4/U_0ckFNGjbI/AAAAAAAAWKA/pKT4pyBiWDM/s1600/ib2.jpg

In theory, what they're doing should work. We'll get used to it over time and all of a sudden things will be easier read. There won't be as many of those hectic teamfights where you die and throw your hands up out of confusion and have to check the death recap to find out what killed you (only to have it bug and say that flash did 728 damage to you or something XD). But yeah. And hopefully it will make it easier to use flash to dodge things more effectively, or realize that there's a cupcake trap in that bush before you accidentally ult on it as Kassadin, or to notice a half second earlier that your Riven ult isn't active because you accidentally tried to activate it while in a Soraka pool. - Things like that. Hopefully. 

But yes, I do agree with you guys some of these "retextures" do look pretty bad. But it's only because they look more dull. It's only human for us to feel that way. As we get older the cones in our eyes pick up less color (one of the reasons people say the world just seems less vibrant as you age - your senses dull - smell, taste, hearing. But that's a whole different subject). But I can prove it to you. 

Here's a picture of some cool snakes: [Snakes](http://i.icap.me/8714150950895832.png)

Now do you want to see what they really look like? [Here](http://i.icap.me/8714150951084449.png)

Still cool, obviously. But kind of depressing when you realize that the real one is more dull in comparison. If you want you can test it out for yourself really easily. Go into your monitor settings and turn the saturation up by 30% or so. Then go about your day for a few hours; play a game of league, watch some anime, etc.. Then revert the saturation. Makes you sad, doesn't it?

So yeah. That's essentially what Riot's doing. It's visually depressing in comparison. But it's for the better good. We'll get used to it.
Best reply and support for a Rioter. *Fist Bump +1*
His username is "Bacon". Must be Baconhawk in disguise. lol
That Plot Twist though. :o
Well damn. Nail head = hit.
Personally, I find the new textures more visually pleasing. The game always felt oversaturated to me, and the changes are right up my alley. Can't wait for the new Rift.

...Sorry, what were you saying? Too busy looking at the pictures of the pretty snakes.

Look how cute cute they are! They look like they're smiling!  And their ideas are so big and adorable, I just wanna give them hugs.

On a more serious note, the only texture rebalancing I have taken serious issue with is LeBlanc's.  Hers looks really wrong to me, especially for the Prestigious skin, but all of them share that unnatural looking skin tone. I also dislike how many (though not all) of the rebalances seem to have the effect of making metal look like plastic.
Can you do this for each original texture? I want to compare Udyr's, Gargas', Mordekaiser's, and Vladimir's.

I'll reply for him, some look like they're plastic/clay toys. He's probably upset that the color pallet change to significantly darker colors than what we're used to so a lot of champions look...more dull. I was really salty at first too but then I played on the new map when it came out and while the texture updates definitely will fit in nicely with the new Summoners Rift, I'm really going to miss my bright colors.

Edit: Old Saint Zilean is my favorite skin that I own and it's actually saddening how not jolly and bright he's going to look
Is there going to be a rework on Sad Robot Amumu, or are you just going to leave it as it is?
Sad Robot Amumu is in a good state, so we probably won't be touching it.

> Sad Robot Amumu is in a good state, so we probably won't be touching it.

Can we have sad robot amumu's global laugh back?
Absolutely not. <3

Neither need it. :)

Edit: Aw, you didn't need to delete your comment. It was legit! D: 

(The original question was about if SGU or PFE were to receive anything.)

Kay, so, first some itty-bitty nitpicks. In no order....

* Frosted Ezreal's hair locks are hard to see individually, at least compared to his blond skins.

* Little Knight Amumu's rear end looks especially slick considering it's supposed to be armored and not skin-esque.

* The hair for all of Vlad's skins (sans Nosferatu and Marquis) feels... I dunno, grainy, like low quality compared to the rest of the piece. It may be that for the most part, the hair is just some thin lines when compared to the rest of his outfit (and each ones' lines with wider bands of color in between).

* I'll echo the need to up the brightness just a tad on Old Saint Zilean.

Okay, that's all I can realistically find. Time to fangirl...

OH MY GOTT MORDE'S FEET ARE STILL PIZZAS BUT THE BASE SKIN LOOKS LIKE THEY'RE DRILLS WITH ALL THOSE RIVETS AND IT JUST MAKES ME THINK HE'LL RAM A DRILL UP YOUR ASS.

TUNDRA FIZZ LOOKS SO ADORABLE AND I CAN ACTUALLY TELL HIS SKIN/FLESH IS A DIFFERENT COLOR THAN HIS BASE.

GRAGAS LOOKS FRICKIN' **RIPPED**.

KOG'MAW DFQWOEHGUWRJA;PQWJRFUOUIOVW *collapses in a fit from too much d'awwwww, especially from the Reindeer skin cause DAMN that looks amazing, a lot more natural looking than the current version*.

TALON GOT SEXIER.

URGOT ACTUALLY LOOKS SCARY (and holy frijoles, that Butcher skin).
Yeah the Butcher Urgot is totally awesome.
Some of the Amumu skins also look quite grainy... Really hoping that gets addressed. :/

Yeah, there are some older characters with some really rough hair that need to be hit.

As for PFE, we didn't think it was in a poor place.

Hey, Crimson Elite Talon's knife is different. I really like the single straight blade in its current form. Could I get you to look over that again? I'm really fond of that sword in its current form.

Other than that these seem pretty good. :D
Uhm... Crimson Elite Talon isn't in here... :o

Reposting from Reddit in case you're mainly checking here!

Well if you're looking for feedback I might as well give my own. I like what you've done with Urgot in general, here are a few comments.

- Personally I think the gold on classic Urgot is not quite tarnished enough.

- Is there a particular reason why Battlecast Urgot went from shiny Silver/Black to Matte Green? Though I think the texture update on it looks great.

- I like how you've really differentiated Butcher Urgot from the baseline skin. I think it'd be even better if the reds came up, or if there was a highlight of fresher 
blood on the apron.

- Crabgot's gonna crabgot. No comment.

b-but I replied over on Reddit...  You just wanted more {{champion:43}} . 


* I can see the golds being a bit bright. Maybe bring some darker colors back on the blade.
* To be more in line with other Battlecast skins. We did similar things on Xerath's Battlecast skin.
* A bit skeptical on fresh blood (not the most internationally friendly).
* Attack its weakpoint for tons of damage

> * A bit skeptical on fresh blood (not the most internationally friendly).

But... doesn't Darius visually rip out a chunk of blood with virtually all of his attacks?  And Vlad does too, and turns into a pool of blood while he's at it. Not necessarily arguing for or against such a change on Urgot (I have no actual opinion in his case), just curious as to what's the differentiating factor between the two that would make one appropriate and the other not?
The Fizz update looks so cute!! Thank you I love it! ♥

Riot when you are retexturing Ezreal anyway, cant you please make it so his hair, in the pulsefire skin, doenst look like a bunch of bananas anymore?http://imgur.com/0Etp5ZP am i the only one who think this looks like a bunch of bananas?
Soraka just found a partner

Can I make a suggestion for Dragonknight Mordekaiser's mace to not have a gray-colored look to the end of it (Try to make the it the a color that matches the rest of his scheme)?

Or is it incomplete?

**Edit

My reasoning for disliking it is, it looks like a ball of dirt with golden spikes coming out of it. Everything looks fine, it's just that one piece if you know what I mean
Noted! Thank you for explaining your reasoning too.

I saw better looking into the toilet after taking a dump.  Jk.  Looks cool.  Hoping to see Kog'Maw and Cho resemble their splash arts in Season 5.  In-game they look like a joke.  But their splash makes me want to play them more!
dat blood lord vlad  :D

You like these, but didn't like the Pentakill one? Interesting. If you care to, I'd be interested to hear your take on the difference between them. 

Also, only these two skins at this time. Infernal needs an update too, at least. Lord might as well.

Think i gonna wait for the before/after picture from Moobeat, it help a lot to see what seems strange on a champion (like the rust on naut)

If you have only the after, when you feel something is strange, you don't always know why you feel that way
All of these are so beautiful! Time Machine Zilean's clock looks so gorgeous.

We definitely need some Morgana up here. I was hoping she'd get a visual update when the Victorious Skin was teased, but since it hit the PBE I guess it's not happening, so I at least hope you will rebalance her skins because, well, look at her poor wings and still green skin. Aside from Ghost Bride, I think all of her skins are in dire need of some love.
I agree, but I don't think textures are the problem. Models and Animations are really what's killing her. She's on the ChampUp list.

What about Caitlyn? She looks really clunky, specially If we put her close to the other Piltovers champs like Jayce, Vi and Jinx, they are all good looking, with nice models, animations and high techs, while Caitlyn looks just old and boring. I really think she needs a VU not just to update her but to make her fit more into her character (A respected Sheriff using a miniskirt?) and look more like a Piltover champion too.

Caitlyn is definitely in line of sight, I saw somewhere, I think it was ironstylus, talking about caitlyn's future appearance. There was some *really* cool concept art in the thread. No idea where that is now, but it's floating around :s This was a while ago though.

I do like all of the textures overall. Most of them give more clarity to the model and make it stand out with the skin's color scheme.

For example, Amumu's are really nice. His classic green is more toned down and easier on the eyes, and the rest of his skins feel that way as well.

Keep in mind I don't have access to PBE at the moment so all opinions I have on this batch are purely based off of images and not the actual in-game experience.

Here are my thoughts/concerns:

1) {{champion:51}} **Sheriff Caitlyn's hair**. I'm biased because I like her live splash art a lot, but I remember a while back that the model's hair was altered from blue to black, and yet it's blue here in the images. Could we change that to match the splash art? One of the biggest complaints with skins is the disparity between models and splashes, and here it feels significant enough to warrant an edit.

2) {{champion:26}} **Zilean's overall color scheme**. I feel that, across all the skins, there might be a darker tone of brown than is necessary. I could be wrong and maybe the lighter tones don't fit as well on the new SR, but it personally looks like a bit difficult to pick out on the map. Especially when you consider that the live Zilean textures are extremely bright, this will throw people off significantly and I'm not sure if the darker tones are thus the way to go. To point out a couple culprits, Shurima and Time Machine both have tones that I feel could be brightened up. Maybe it's the gloves? I'm not sure.

3) {{champion:79}} **Gragas' skin tone.** This is more due to perspective because of the close-ups, but I feel it's a bit jarring that his skin tone is significantly more subdued. Since all the textures were intended to have less visually cluttering schemes, I can understand why it's more tan (or peach, or beige? I don't know haha). I would like to point out though, that Caitlyn's and Ezreal's skin tones look brighter than Gragas, and that may be why it looks odd to me. Argument against this is that Gragas is substantially more naked than the other two (from the waist up, lest anyone dare imply that's not what I was referring to with the word choice).

Other than, I'm looking forward to the texture changes! Thanks for the hard work!

I agree about Caitlyn's hair. Sheriff, Safari and Resistance Caitlyn splash arts all have brown hair, and even the old main splash had it too. And honestly I like the brown/black hair a lot more than blue, I think it fits a lot better. Specially Sheriff Caitlyn because that blue is too light.
